intro: Warrea bidentata, commonly known as the two-toothed warrea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
